title: Apple, Google Come Under Fire at Senate Antitrust Hearing
sub_head: Lawmakers, mobile app companies take aim at tech giants’ power over their smartphone ecosystems
body:
WASHINGTON—Lawmakers and mobile app companies took aim at Apple Inc. and Alphabet Inc.’s Google in a hearing Wednesday focused on competition concerns about the companies’ power over their smartphone ecosystems.
The hearing marked an escalation of lawmakers’ antitrust scrutiny on smartphone makers, and particularly Apple .
Google already has been sued by federal and state authorities for alleged antitrust violations, but much of that scrutiny has focused on its search and advertising businesses.
